alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Marion (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 10:56AM EST until March 10 at 5:48AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... White River from Noblesville to Hazleton. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. Moderate flooding in the Seymour area on the East Fork White River is expected to persist into Thursday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Noblesville. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 14.5 feet, Edith Avenue begins to flood near the Potter Bridge area. Flooding begins in residential areas along East 116th Street in the Trails End area, along East 146th Street, and SR 19 just north of SR 32. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM EST Wednesday was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this afternoon and continue falling to 6.4 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued this evening by around 1100 PM EST /1000 PM CST/.
